main event: A luminous flash was observed by flying officers over Rome, New York on May 23, 1950.
interesting points: The flash was observed to travel at an extremely fast speed, estimated to be 3-5 miles in altitude, and last for 2-3 seconds.
The flash was observed to travel in a straight path from west to east with no change in motion.
The sighting was reported to higher authorities and investigated as part of Project Blue Book, the U.S. Air Force's study of unidentified aerial phenomena.
The sighting was later confirmed to be a meteor by several sources.
The report mentions other similar sightings in the northeastern United States and Canada on November 2, 1950, which were also investigated as part of Project Blue Book.
